Leslie Sabo left behind

The President of the

956.99.text:
authorized by Act of

to Specialist Four

967.33.text:
United States Army for
conspicuous gallantry and

970.63.text:

975.06.text:
Specialist Four Leslie H. Sabo,
Jr. distinguished himself by

978.12.text:
conspicuous acts of gallantry
and intrepidity above and beyond

981.59.text:
the call of duty at the cost of
his own life while serving as a

984.93.text:
rifleman in Company B, 3rd
Battalion, 506th Infantry,

989.63.text:
101st Airborne Division in Se
San, Cambodia, May 10th, 1970.

996.02.text:
On that day, Specialist Four
Sabo and his platoon were

998.39.text:
conducting a reconnaissance
patrol when they were ambushed

1001.22.text:
from all sides by a
large enemy force.

1003.83.text:
Without hesitation, Specialist
Four Sabo charged an enemy

1009.46.text:
Immediately thereafter, he
assaulted an enemy flanking

1012.06.text:
force, successfully drawing
their fire away from friendly

1014.73.text:
soldiers and ultimately
forcing the enemy to retreat.

1019.93.text:
he sprinted across an open
field to a wounded comrade.

1023.36.text:
As he began to reload, an
enemy grenade landed nearby.

1026.99.text:
Specialist Four Sabo
picked it up, threw it,

1029.69.text:
and shielded his comrade

1031.93.text:
thus absorbing the brunt
of the blast and saving

1035.83.text:
Seriously wounded by the blast,

1039.02.text:
retained the initiative and then

1042.49.text:
bunker that had inflicted
severe damage on the platoon,

1045.46.text:
receiving several serious wounds
from automatic weapons fire in

1050.12.text:
Now mortally injured, he crawled
towards the enemy emplacement

1053.36.text:
and, when in position, threw
a grenade into the bunker.

1057.22.text:
The resulting explosion
silenced the enemy fire,

1059.99.text:
but also ended Specialist
Four Sabo's life.

1063.22.text:
His indomitable courage and
complete disregard for his own

1065.69.text:
safety saved the lives of
many of his platoon members.

1068.89.text:
Specialist Four Sabo's
extraordinary heroism and

1071.33.text:
selflessness, above and
beyond the call of duty,

1074.43.text:
at the cost of his life, are
in keeping with the highest

1077.26.text:
traditions of military service
and reflect great credit upon

1084.86.text:
101st Airborne Division,
and the United States Army.
